questions.question: Please fill ……………………… this application for visa.
questions.description: To fill out/in a form is to write information in the spaces on a form.

questions.question: He did ………………………… the buttons on his shirt.
questions.description: To do something up is to fasten it.

questions.question: I tripped on a rock and fell …………………………
questions.description: If a person falls over, they fall to the ground.

questions.question: I broke the flower vase and I am really worried that Mum will find ………………………….
questions.description: To find out is to learn the facts about something.

questions.question: It took him a long time to get ……………………………. her death.
questions.description: To get over is to become happy again after an unhappy experience.

questions.question: He refused to give ………………………….. to our demands.
questions.description: To give in is to agree to do something although you are not happy about it.

questions.question: She struggled to pass the test, but she never thought of giving …………………………
questions.description: To give up is to stop trying to do it.

questions.question: The girl started singing and everyone else joined …………………………..
questions.description: To join in something is to take part in an activity with other people.

questions.question: Why did they leave him ………………………… of the team?
questions.description: To leave somebody out is to not include them.

questions.question: I need someone to look …………………………. the kids while I am away.
questions.description: To look after someone is to take care of them.

questions.question: It was a lie. I made it …………………………..
questions.description: To make something up is to invent something.

questions.question: Put the meat ………………………… in the fridge.
questions.description: To put something away is to put it in the place where it is usually kept.
